ferrn 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Bind random bases in the projection bases space

Source: R/bind.R
bind_random.Rd

Given the orthonormality constraint, the projection bases live in a high dimensional hollow sphere. Generating random points on the sphere is useful to preceive the data object in the high dimensional space.

bind_random(dt, n = 500)

Arguments

dt

A data object from the running the optimisation algorithm in guided tour
n

Number of random points to generate in each dimension

See also

Other bind: bind_random_matrix(), bind_theoretical()

Examples

bind_random(holes_1d_better) %>% tail(5)
